intro: Corunastylis carecta, commonly known as the slender false flax, is a herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
